column4: hey guys, i need help concerning the command line for application installation (compile-link) thing, i dont wanna use the application manager anymore !! I have a tar ball extracted to desktop in a directorie
if you are compiling, you need a compiler + libs
and then the make would work properly ?
got it, now i have my directory on my desktop. what should I do to install it, when i type make, it gets pretty confusing
read the readme and install files
when i install the install-essential pack i dont know where it went. like by default where should it go so i can i find it and read the read me file...
yu dont have to worry where it is, its on your system and you can use t freely
you just need to run through the building instructions in the file you extracted
same way you have firefox installed but you dont know where it is or what files it uses to run, it just runs
